Basic.name: bar
Basic.title: Simple Bar Chart
Basic.description: A bar chart encodes quantitative values as the extent of rectangular bars.

Basic.name: point_invalid_color
Basic.title: Scatterplot with Null Values in Grey

Basic.title: Line Chart with Overlaying Point Markers

Basic.name: area_overlay
Basic.title: Area Chart with Overlaying Lines and Point Markers

Basic.name: bar_color_disabled_scale
Basic.title: A bar chart encoding color names in the data.

Basic.name: circle_natural_disasters
Basic.description: Visualization of global deaths from natural disasters. Copy of chart from [Our World in Data](https://ourworldindata.org/natural-catastrophes)
Basic.title: Natural Disasters

Layering.name: layer_bar_annotations
Layering.title: Bar chart that highlights values beyond a threshold
Layering.description: To create a bar chart that highlights values beyond a threshold, we use two `layer`s of `bar` marks. The lower layer shows all the bars while the upper layer shows bar with values above the threshold in red (`#e45755`).  We then `layer` a `rule` mark and a `text` mark over the bars to annotate the threshold value.

Layering.name: layer_histogram_global_mean
Layering.title: Histogram with a Global Mean Overlay

Layering.name: layer_global_mean_dev
Layering.title: Scatterplot with Mean and Standard Deviation Overlay

Layering.name: layer_area_ci
Layering.title: Line chart with Confidence Interval Band

Layering.name: layer_connected_scatterplot
Layering.title: Connected Scatterplot (Lines with Custom Paths)
Layering.description: A connected scatterplot can be created by customizing line `order`.  Here we also use [the shared `encoding` property of a layered plot](layer.html).

Layering.name: layer_line_co2_concentration
Layering.title: Carbon Dioxide in the Atmosphere
Layering.description: Note: When accessing aggregated argmax or argmin fields, the aggregated fields must be flattened using calculate (see https://github.com/vega/vega-lite/issues/3361).

Composition.name: repeat_layer
Composition.title: Repeat and layer to show different weather measures

Composition.name: vconcat_weather
Composition.title: Vertically concatenated charts that show precipitation in Seattle
Composition.description: Two vertically concatenated charts that show a histogram of precipitation in Seattle and the relationship between min and max temperature.

Composition.name: repeat_histogram
Composition.title: Horizontally repeated charts
Composition.description: Horizontally repeated charts that show the histograms of different parameters of cars in different countries.

Geographical (Maps).name: geo_layer_line_london
Geographical (Maps).title: London Tube Lines

Interactive.name: selection_layer_bar_month
Interactive.title: Interactive Average
Interactive.description: The plot below uses an interval selection, which causes the chart to include an interactive brush (shown in grey). The brush selection parameterizes the red guideline, which visualizes the average value within the selected interval.

Interactive.name: interactive_multi_line_tooltip
Interactive.title: Multi Series Line Chart with Tooltips
Interactive.description: The plot displays tooltips for all stock prices of the hovered time. The example is forked/modified from [@jakevdp's block](https://bl.ocks.org/jakevdp/a414950f61e4b224765f2439dd1f09b9).
